basic.description: This course is an applied or creative project (comparable in scope to a thesis) that serves to demonstrate the skills or knowledge that students have developed throughout their master's program resulting in a non-traditional deliverable (e.g., a performance, implementation of campaign, film/video, or other). Requires independent work reflecting analysis or interpretation, as well as application of skills or theoretical concepts to a new context. Must include a proposal and defense, as well as a final defense with a final deliverable. May be repeated to a maximum of six semester hours.
basic.subject: COM
basic.title: Capstone Creative Project
